metadata.title: CVE-2024-26790 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:dmaengine: fsl-qdma: fix SoC may hang on 16 byte unaligned read There ischip (ls1028a) errata: The SoC may hang on 16 byte unaligned readtransactions by QDMA. Unaligned read transactions initiated by QDMA maystall in the NOC (Network On-Chip), causing a deadlock condition. Stalledtransactions will trigger completion timeouts in PCIe controller.Workaround: Enable prefetch by setting the source descriptor prefetchablebit ( SD[PF] = 1 ). Implement this workaround.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
